meanings.definition: The state of being twofold or double.
meanings.sent1: The duplexity of the mirror created an interesting reflection.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting showcased the duplexity of colors blending together.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the duplexity of the hidden compartments.
meanings.sent4: The duplexity of her personality was both charming and perplexing.
meanings.sent5: The duplexity of the coin made it difficult to determine which side was heads or tails.

meanings.definition: The quality of having two parts or aspects.
meanings.sent1: The duplexity of the problem required a creative solution.
meanings.sent2: The duplexity of the story kept the audience engaged till the end.
meanings.sent3: The duplexity of the cake's flavors surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The duplexity of the situation demanded careful consideration of both sides.
meanings.sent5: The duplexity of the puzzle made it challenging yet enjoyable to solve.

meanings.definition: The property of being composed of two elements.
meanings.sent1: The duplexity of the compound made it unique in the chemical world.
meanings.sent2: The duplexity of the melody combined two contrasting tones beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The duplexity of the recipe called for an unusual mix of ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The duplexity of the design highlighted the harmony between form and function.
meanings.sent5: The duplexity of the equation required solving for both variables to find the answer.
